body: @fenghuanfun Because MySQLParser doesn't support the function of `date_format`. @terrymanu Please assign to me for the bug.
@SteNicholas Thank you, assigned
@fenghuanfun The reason is that MySQLParser doesn't support function like `date_format`. Sharding column should be supported by the supported function.
@terrymanu @tuohai666 I will fix this bug. Please assign to me.
@SteNicholas Thank you, assigned
/run ci
run /ci

@iamamaster Your SQL is something wrong that `UNOIN` both side select statements are unnecssary to add `()`. Parser module has already supported `UNION` grammar.

Not a bug, only grammar error.

If you wanna sort your records after union, you should add a select to wrap the union and then with order clause.
what is your special table name?
@SteNicholas Assigned.
No plan to do this, it is not a necessary path for insert

`UNION` is not easy to support, beside parse, we need to do query engine too.
We have no plan to do union for now
